import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";
import RequestSchema from "@theme/RequestSchema";
import StatusCodes from "@theme/StatusCodes";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get issue type by ID"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/issues/types/{issueTypeId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves a single issue type definition by ID, including scope and product metadata. Use this when inspecting or editing issue types.

**Prerequisites**
1. **issueTypeId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/issues/types](/docs/api/issues/list-issue-types) or [POST /api/v1.0/issues/types](/docs/api/issues/search-issue-types) and extract `Items[].IssueTypeId`.

**Workflow Example**
1. List issue types and capture the target `IssueTypeId`.
2. Retrieve details: [GET /api/v1.0/issues/types/\{issueTypeId\}](/docs/api/issues/get-issue-type-by-id).

**Minimal Required Fields**: issueTypeId (path).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"issueTypeId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
